funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.toolbox

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.toolbox.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for windowing sample buffers

    Arrays of both double and float are supported. Hamming, Hanning, Blackman, and Gaussian Windows are available.

    See Also:
    WaveFrame

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window(int windowType)
        Construct a new Window instance with the specified window type.
        Parameters:
        windowType - the window type to use. Valid window types are WINDOW_HAMMING, WINDOW_HANNING, WINDOW_BLACKMAN, or WINDOW_GAUSSIAN.

        public Window()
        Construct a new Window instance with a rectangular window

        Returns:
        the window type. Valid window types are WINDOW_HAMMING, WINDOW_HANNING, WINDOW_BLACKMAN, or WINDOW_GAUSSIAN.

      • setWindowType

        public void setWindowType(int windowType)
        Set the window type of this Window instance.
        Parameters:
        windowType - the window type to use. Valid window types are WINDOW_HAMMING, WINDOW_HANNING, WINDOW_BLACKMAN, or WINDOW_GAUSSIAN.

      • Gaussian

        public static float[] Gaussian(float[] x,
                               double alpha)
        Returns a windowed signal using a standard Gaussian window with alpha to adjust the window width. Alpha is proportional to the standard deviation of the resulting window sigma = (N-1)/2*alpha.
        Parameters:
        x - the signal array
        alpha - alpha value to adjust window width
        Returns:
        the windowed signal array

      • Gaussian

        public static double[] Gaussian(double[] x,
                                double alpha)
        Returns a windowed signal using a standard Gaussian window with alpha to adjust the window width. Alpha is proportional to the standard deviation of the resulting window sigma = (N-1)/2*alpha.
        Parameters:
        x - the signal array
        alpha - alpha value to adjust window width
        Returns:
        the windowed signal array
